articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Stock Moves -1.94%: What You Should Know
articles.content: In the most recent trading session, Apple (AAPL) closed at $193.16, indicating a -1.94% shift from the previous trading day.

articles.title: Apple's China Dependence Leaves It Exposed as Tariff Risks Rise
articles.content: Apple makes 90% of iPhones in China, keeping it exposed to U.S. tariffs.

articles.title: Apple's China Gamble at Risk as Global Tariff War Heats Up, Analyst Warns
articles.content: Apple could face sharp risks if U.S. allies join in raising tariffs on China, Kuo said.

articles.title: Apple Faces Growing Risk If China Trade Tensions Spread Globally
articles.content: Tariff ripple effects could force Apple to diversify production as geopolitical risks around China trade expand

articles.title: Apple vs. Meta Platforms: Which "Magnificent Seven" Stock Has More Upside After the Recent Sell-Off?
articles.content: The Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF, an exchange-traded fund that tracks "Magnificent Seven" stocks, is down close to 18% this year.  While uncertainty is at an all-time high, investors are also circling the wagons and looking at stocks that are as cheap as they have been in six months or more.  Many investors remain bullish on artificial intelligence (AI) and believe few stocks will benefit more than those in the Magnificent Seven.

articles.title: Apple Shares Dip 21% Year to Date: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
articles.content: AAPL shares have dropped on tariff concerns. Stiff competition in China and a stretched valuation are other concerns.
